Managers are leaders who guide and direct their team members, rather than being the primary source of information on every aspect of their work.

As a manager in a mid-sized company in Johannesburg, I have found that it is more important to possess strong leadership skills and the ability to facilitate effective communication and collaboration among team members. This includes being approachable, transparent, and fair in my decision-making, and creating an environment that encourages open dialogue and the sharing of ideas.

While having all the answers may be ideal in some situations, it is not always possible or necessary. As a manager, my role is to provide guidance and support, rather than being the sole source of knowledge on every topic. I believe that a good manager can balance the need for accurate information with the need to empower team members to take ownership of their work and make decisions with confidence."
